item.title: 德国假肢公司奥托博克及其所有者在首次公开募股中寻求 7.09 亿欧元投资
item.description: 假肢制造商奥托博克公司（Ottobock SE）及其家族股东希望通过在法兰克福首次公开募股，筹集高达 7.087 亿欧元（8.312 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Prosthetics maker Ottobock SE and its family shareholder are looking to raise as much as €708.7 million ($831.2 million) through an initial public offering in Frankfurt.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市将上涨，英镑升值
汽车零部件供应商 First Brands 申请破产
item.description: 根据一份法庭文件，汽车零部件供应商 First Brands Group Holdings 在得克萨斯州申请破产保护，列出了 100 亿至 500 亿美元的负债。【原文：Auto-parts supplier First Brands Group Holdings filed for Chapter 11 in Texas, listing liabilities of between $10 billion and $50 billion, according to a court document.】

item.title: 停摆迫在眉睫，美元在事件频发的一周开局不利
item.description: 美元在事件频发的本周开始下跌。【原文：The dollar has started an event-loaded week with declines.】

item.title: 前红杉合伙人寻求以 4 亿美元的 Evantic Capital 重塑风险投资行业
item.description: 马特-米勒（Matt Miller）去年 12 月离开红杉资本，像许多长期从事风险投资的人一样，选择创办自己的基金。不过，他并没有采用标准的风险投资模式。【原文：Matt Miller left Sequoia Capital last December and, like many longtime venture capitalists, chose to start his own fund. He didn’t, however, take the standard VC model with him.】

item.title: 水下机器人制造商获得 5200 万美元资金用于全球推广
item.description: 海王星机器人公司（Neptune Robotics）制造清洁巨轮底部的机器人，该公司筹集了 5200 万美元，以加速其人工智能推动的全球扩张。【原文：Neptune Robotics, which makes robots that clean the underside of giant ships, raised $52 million to accelerate its artificial intelligence-fueled global expansion.】

item.title: 欧洲央行考虑在印度债券清算风波中为德意志银行和法国巴黎银行提供缓刑措施
item.description: 在与新德里的监管纠纷威胁到数十亿卢比的政府债务和利率衍生品交易后，欧洲中央银行正在与各大银行商谈放宽与印度主权债券清算所合作的贷款机构的额外资本规定。【原文：The European Central Bank is in talks with major banks about relaxing extra capital rules for lenders working with India’s sovereign bond clearing house, after a regulatory dispute with New Delhi threatened to disrupt billions of rupees in government debt and interest-rate derivatives trading.】

item.title: 亚洲货币因美元走软和中国工厂盈利而反弹
item.description: 由于美元走软，且中国工厂利润数据显示经济企稳，亚洲货币和新兴市场股市周一走高。【原文：Asian currencies and emerging-market equities advanced Monday as the dollar weakened and Chinese factory profit data pointed to a stabilizing economy.】

item.title: 日本民调对小泉还是高市在自民党竞选中领先意见不一
item.description: 距离日本执政党选举新领导人还有不到一周的时间，民意调查显示，政治后代小泉进次郎还是右翼人士佐佐江隆一在该党支持者中的支持率最高。【原文：With less than a week until Japan’s ruling party is set to elect a new leader, opinion polls are split over whether political scion Shinjiro Koizumi or right-leaning Sanae Takaichi has the most backing among the party’s supporters.】

item.title: Kedaara Capital 筹集 3 亿美元资产延续基金
item.description: 印度最大的本地私募股权公司之一 Kedaara Capital Investment Management Ltd. 已完成了其第一笔续期投资，投资额为 3 亿美元。【原文：Kedaara Capital Investment Management Ltd., one of India’s largest local private equity firms, has closed its first continuation vehicle at $300 million, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 日本经济下滑，丰田受惠于中国和北美市场销售
item.description: 丰田汽车公司（Toyota Motor Corp. ）的销售额创下历史新高，其中包括在中国和北美的稳定增长，但在日本国内急剧下降后，其势头已有所减弱。【原文：Toyota Motor Corp.’s record sales run, including steady growth in China and North America, has lost steam after a sharp drop back home in Japan.】

item.title: 分析师看好人工智能和云计算，阿里巴巴股价攀升
item.description: 阿里巴巴集团控股有限公司（Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.）股价上涨，分析师称该公司云计算和人工智能业务的增长前景有所改善，因此该公司股价成为本月香港市场表现最好的中国科技公司。【原文：Shares of Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., the top performer among Chinese tech names in Hong Kong this month, rallied as analysts touted improving growth prospects for the company’s cloud and artificial intelligence businesses.】

item.title: 从关税到军队，市场正在屏蔽杂音
item.description:
怎么做？有一件事白宫做得很好。【原文：

How? There’s one thing the White House is playing like a maestro.

】

item.title: 法国向富人开刀以摆脱政治瘫痪
item.description: 无论如何，税官都会来找法国最富有的公民。【原文：One way or another, the taxman is coming for France’s wealthiest citizens.】

item.title: 高盛称矿业股将助推南非股市上涨
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：South African stocks are set to extend this year’s rally, supported by a weaker dollar and strong mining stocks, according to Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists.】

item.title: KKR 投资斯特林广场支持的软件公司 Infobric
item.description: KKR & Co. 将投资 Infobric，这是一家专注于建筑行业的软件公司，由 Stirling Square 提供支持。【原文：KKR & Co. is investing in Infobric, a software company focused on the construction industry that’s backed by Stirling Square.】

item.title: 空置的微软大厦引发澳大利亚基金拖欠贷款
item.description: 澳大利亚第二大养老基金--澳大利亚退休信托基金（Australian Retirement Trust）正在拖欠一笔贷款，这笔贷款曾用于购买微软公司（Microsoft Corp.澳大利亚第二大养老基金--澳大利亚退休信托基金（Australian Retirement Trust）正在拖欠一笔贷款，这笔贷款用于购买美国微软公司（Microsoft Corp.【原文：Australian Retirement Trust, the nation’s no. 2 pension fund, is defaulting on a loan that funded the purchase of a US office complex once occupied by Microsoft Corp., underscoring the continued fallout for global investors as companies revise their office space.】

item.title: EQT 11 亿美元出售中国银科失败，Advent 支付分手费
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 Advent 已支付了分手费，因为该公司计划斥资 11 亿美元从 EQT AB 收购一家隐形眼镜生产商的交易在接近终点时告吹。【原文：Private equity firm Advent has paid breakup fees after a planned $1.1 billion deal to buy a contact-lens maker from EQT AB fell through near the finish line, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 亿万富翁阿加瓦尔的韦丹塔公司考虑发行债券偿还私人债务
item.description: 亿万富翁阿尼尔-阿加瓦尔（Anil Agarwal）的韦丹塔资源有限公司（Vedanta Resources Ltd.）计划周一与固定收益投资者就最早于本周出售美元债券进行谈判，以帮助偿还私人信用贷款。【原文：Billionaire Anil Agarwal’s Vedanta Resources Ltd. plans to hold talks Monday with fixed-income investors on a dollar bond sale for as early as this week to help repay a private credit facility.】

item.title: 中国在抑制产能过剩的同时下调主要金属增长目标
item.description: 中国已削减了 2025 年和 2026 年主要有色金属的年产量增长目标，这凸显出中国的政策已从数量扩张转向效率和可持续性。【原文：China has slashed its annual output growth target for key non-ferrous metals over 2025 and 2026, underscoring a policy shift from volume expansion to efficiency and sustainability.】

item.title: 美国加征关税，新西兰葡萄种植者迎接艰难的一年
item.description: 据行业机构称，新西兰葡萄酒业正准备迎接充满挑战的一年，因为美国的关税可能会抑制其最大市场的需求，而2025年的丰收又会增加供应。【原文：New Zealand’s wine industry is bracing for a challenging year as US tariffs threaten to curb demand in its largest market just as a strong 2025 harvest increases supply, according to the industry body.】

item.title: 印度 IT 股在经历 2 月以来最长连跌后有望走出困境
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 塔塔资本 IPO 募资 17 亿美元，创印度 2025 年最大上市纪录
item.description: 塔塔资本有限公司（Tata Capital Ltd. ）的首次公开募股正在寻求筹集高达 1,550 亿卢比（17 亿美元）的资金，这将是印度今年迄今为止规模最大的一次上市。【原文：Tata Capital Ltd.’s initial public offering is seeking to raise as much as 155 billion rupees ($1.7 billion), in what is set to be India’s largest listing so far this year.】

item.title: 日本电产会计丑闻扩大影响信任度，股价下滑
item.description: 日本电产公司（Nidec Corp. ）发现了更多涉嫌不当记账的情况，这加剧了人们对这家全球最大的微型电机制造商可能会受到监管审查而退市的担忧，从而导致该公司股价下滑。【原文：Nidec Corp. shares slid after the company discovered more suspected cases of improper bookkeeping, heightening fears the world’s biggest maker of mini motors may come under regulatory scrutiny for a potential delisting.】

item.title: 中国九月份液化天然气进口量连续第十一个月下降
item.description: 中国九月份的液化天然气进口量将比去年同期下降五分之一以上，在国内供应和管道天然气流量保持强劲的情况下，中国的液化天然气采购量将继续下滑。【原文：China’s imports of liquefied natural gas in September are poised to drop more than a fifth from a year ago, extending a slump in purchases as domestic supplies and piped flows remain robust.】

item.title: 中国假期前投资者转趋谨慎，铁矿石下跌
item.description: 由于中国将从周三起休市一周，在这一重大节假日之前，市场基调谨慎，铁矿石下跌。【原文：Iron ore declined due to a cautious tone ahead of a major holiday in China that’ll see mainland markets closed for a week from Wednesday.】

item.title: 债券交易员寄希望于鸽派的印度央行重振低迷市场
item.description: 最近几周，印度债券一直处于无精打采的交易状态，分析师称，只有本周印度储备银行发出强烈的鸽派信号，才可能有助于重燃看涨情绪。【原文：Indian bonds have been stuck in listless trading in recent weeks, with analysts saying only strong dovish signals from the Reserve Bank of India this week may help rekindle bullish sentiment.】

item.title: 北京削减炼油能力计划在部分地区遭遇挫折
item.description: "先建新，后废旧 "可以写在中国承诺解决工业产能过剩问题的墓碑上。【原文：“Build the new before abolishing the old” could be written on the tombstone of China’s pledge to fix its problem with industrial overcapacity.】

item.title: 日本股市下跌，除息股拖累基准股价
item.description: 日本股市周一下跌，原因是 3 月和 9 月财年结束的除息股票拖累了股价基准。【原文：Japanese shares fell on Monday as ex-dividend stocks with fiscal year endings in March and September weighed on the stock price benchmarks.】

item.title: 交易员权衡美国停摆和美联储利率，黄金接近历史最高水平
item.description: 由于交易商考虑到美国政府可能关门，这可能会推迟本周关键就业数据的公布，并可能给美联储的货币政策路径蒙上阴影，黄金走高。【原文：Gold edged higher — after notching a sixth weekly gain — as traders weighed a potential US government shutdown that could delay the release of pivotal jobs data this week and potentially cloud the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy path.】
